text:
In this chapter, we encountered derivatives of functions. Figure 5.6 sum-
marizes the dimensions of those derivatives. If f : R →R the gradient is
simply a scalar (top-left entry). For f : RD →R the gradient is a 1 ×D
row vector (top-right entry). For f : R →RE, the gradient is an E×1
column vector, and for f : RD →RE the gradient is an E×Dmatrix.
Draft (2019-10-15) of “Mathematics for Machine Learning”. Feedback:https://mml-book.com.
